intro: Eriocaulon fysonii, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a member of the plant family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown, and it relies on wind pollination. Eriocaulon fysonii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
